newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai preliminary exports for April at 112 bln baht.
newsitem.headline: Thai preliminary exports for April at 112 bln baht.

text.p: Thai Customs Department's preliminary figures showed April exports amounted to 112.79 billion baht ($4.34 billion) -- a 5.1 percent increase from the same period last year, the finance ministry said.
Imports, on CIF basis, during the same period reached 147.4 billion baht, down 13.06 billion baht, or 8.1 percent, from April 1996, a ministry statement said.
The figure confirmed comments made earlier by a senior financial official.
According to Customs Department records, the trade deficit in April totalled 34.61 billion baht, down 18.53 billion baht from the same period last year, the statement said.
This put the January-April trade deficit at 129.01 billion baht compared with a 161.23 billion baht deficit in the same period last year, it said.

The figures are preliminary and unofficial. Official economic data is released by the central bank. Figures from the Customs Department differ slightly from those of the central bank but they both usually reflect the same trend.
